title: Real-Time Well Verification
subtitle: Instant Compliance Validation for Injection Operations
teaser: Cross-reference injection sites against permitted wells database for instant verification before fluid disposal.
body:
Ensuring Compliance with Every Injection

The application cross-references each injection site against an up-to-date database of permitted wells, providing instant verification before any fluid disposal operation begins. This proactive approach prevents violations before they occur.

Verification Process

A core pillar of UIC compliance is ensuring that disposal activities only occur at properly permitted wells. Mistakenly or fraudulently injecting fluid at an unregistered or suspended site can result in immediate regulatory violations, fines, or environmental liabilities. Our application prevents such errors at the point of action through a robust system of real-time well verification.
  • Database Integration: Real-time connection to state and federal permit databases
  • GPS Correlation: Automatic matching of location to permitted well coordinates
  • Permit Status: Instant verification of current permit validity and restrictions
  • Volume Limits: Automatic checking against daily and monthly injection limits

Compliance Benefits

Manual well identification, relying on paper logs, memory, or loosely labeled infrastructure introduces unacceptable risk. State regulators maintain active well status databases, and operators must prove not only that fluids were injected but that they were injected at the correct and permitted site. Automating this verification adds a crucial compliance safeguard and greatly reduces human error. Since implementation, our clients have achieved 100% compliance rates with zero permit violations. The system continues to prevent potential violations through proactive alerts, saving operators millions in potential fines and protecting their operational licenses.

Advanced Features

The verification system includes predictive analytics that forecast permit expiration's and volume limit approaches, allowing operators to plan ahead and maintain continuous compliance. 

Real-Time Well Verification: Preventing Unauthorized Disposal Before It Happens

A core pillar of UIC compliance is ensuring that disposal activities only occur at properly permitted wells. Mistakenly or fraudulently injecting fluid at an unregistered or suspended site can result in immediate regulatory violations, fines, or environmental liabilities. Our application prevents such errors at the point of action through a robust system of real-time well verification.

The application maintains a synchronized database of permitted wells including metadata such as API number, lease name, operator, and well status (active, suspended, shut-in). This database is periodically pulled from state or operator APIs and stored locally on the mobile device to support offline operation.

Each well is defined as a geofenced polygon or precise coordinate location, tagged with its regulatory status. When a vehicle enters a site boundary, the app immediately attempts to match the current GPS coordinates to a known permitted well. This is done via a fast spatial index lookup followed by a geofencing algorithm to confirm boundary containment.

If no match is found, or if the well is flagged as inactive or suspended, the app prevents any UIC workflow from proceeding. In most deployments, this blocks the ability to initiate flow meter capture, sign tickets, or generate reports until the issue is resolved. Administrators are notified via backend alerting systems, and the event is logged for audit purposes.

To avoid false positives near the edge of overlapping or adjacent wells, the verification system includes a confidence zone buffer and time thresholding logic to ensure that fleeting GPS errors do not trigger a block. The verification step is also tied to driver authentication and site dwell time to ensure temporal alignment with valid disposal operations.
